title: VP, Government Affairs
content:
SeatGeek believes live events are powerful experiences that unite humans. With our technological savvy and fan-first attitude we’re simplifying and modernizing the ticketing industry. 
By catering to both consumers and enterprises, we’re powering a new, open entertainment ecosystem where fans have effortless access to experiences, and teams, venues, and shows have seamless access to their audiences. Because everyone should expect more from ticketing.
In this role, you’ll become SeatGeek’s first dedicated government affairs professional.  This position is responsible for managing all government affairs initiatives for the Company.  You will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to engage with government entities at the state and federal levels. You will work closely with internal and external stakeholders, such as federal and state government officials, policymakers, industry associations, and other relevant stakeholders, to advocate for SeatGeek’s interests and promote its objectives. You will be a key member of SeatGeek’s legal team and report to our General Counsel
What you'll do

Develop and implement government affairs initiatives that align with the Company's goals and objectives
Monitor and analyze legislative and regulatory developments that may impact SeatGeek and recommend appropriate actions. Engage with state and federal officials to ensure the successful outcome of potential legislation
Build and maintain relationships with government officials, policymakers, industry associations, and other relevant stakeholders to advocate for the Company's interests. Represent SeatGeek in meetings, hearings, and other forums, and effectively communicate the organization's positions on relevant issues
Work closely with members of the legal and product teams to ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations
Collaborate with internal teams, including legal and communications, to align government affairs strategies with broader organizational goals and initiatives
Champion our industry and coordinate our participation and influence in applicable associations
Research and analyze relevant issue areas, legislation, and regulatory matters and make recommendations on how best to engage on such matters

What you have

Degree in public policy, government affairs or related field
Minimum of 12 years of experience in public policy, lobbying or related roles, preferably in the technology or live events industries
Excellent communication skills, including written and verbal communication, presentation, and negotiation skills
Demonstrated experience in developing and executing government affairs strategies, initiatives, and campaigns
Ability to build and maintain relationships with government officials, policymakers, industry associations, and other relevant stakeholders
Strong research, analysis, and problem-solving skills with attention to detail
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment

Perks

Equity stake
Flexible work environment, allowing you to work as many days a week in the office as you’d like or 100% remotely
A WFH stipend to support your home office setup
Flexible PTO
Up to 16 weeks of paid family leave
401(k) matching program
Health, vision, dental, and life insurance
Annual subscriptions to Headspace, Ginger.io, and One Medical 
$120 a month to spend on tickets to live events
Annual subscription to Spotify, Apple Music, or Amazon music

 

The salary range for this role is $240,000-$365,000. Actual compensation packages within that range are based on a wide array of factors unique to each candidate, including but not limited to skill set, years and depth of experience, certifications, and specific location.
